title.native: Mnemosyne－ムネモシュネの娘たち－

description:
Rin Asogi is an immortal private detective with a thirst for vodka and a talent for attracting things that go bump in the night. In a series of nightmarish vignettes spanning sixty-five years, Rin's lush body is sadistically pierced, blown up, and mulched to a bloody pulp. The fiend behind her tortured existence is Apos, an eternal being obsessed with sacrificing Rin to Yggdrasil, the tree of all life. While Rin struggles to unravel the secrets of her endless agony, Apos lurks in the shadows, eager to tear into her ripe body and devour the memories of her countless lives. Rin's no stranger to the realm of the dead, but her next visit could last forever.

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Ero Guro
tags.description: Japanese literary and artistic movement originating in the 1930's. Works have a focus on grotesque eroticism, sexual corruption, and decadence.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

title.native: Mnemosyne-ムネモシュネの娘たち-
ムネモシュネの娘たち2008

node.description:
**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jmichaeltatum)

Married to fellow voice actor [Brandon McInnis](https://anilist.co/staff/127809/).

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

Galneryus was formed in early 2001 by guitarist Syu (formerly from Valkyr, Animetal, Aushvitz, and Masaki Project) along with vocalist Yama-B, frontman of AxBites, Rekion, River End and solo artist of Gunbridge. Both veterans of the Japanese metal scene they formed Galneryus with the intention to "express both of their musical tastes/ideas" and so they started looking for additional members to complete the band. They recruited A on keyboards (who had previously played with Syu in Valkyr), Shôgo Himuro on bass, and Toshihiro "Tossan" Yui (formerly of Cemetery, Honey Quest) on drums.

In October 2001, the band released a 2-track demo titled "United Flag". The demo was self-produced and released independently. This EP started gaining the attention of both fans and independent record labels as well.

After playing with other metal bands like Fairy Mirror, Mephistopheles, Galactica Phantom, Mastermind, and Concerto Moon, Galneryus went back to the studio to record a second EP. Rebel Flag was released through the independent label Iron Shock in August 2002. The EP again used support musicians to fill the band slots, with Shôgo Himuro again on bass, Toshihiro Yui again on drums, and Yoshinori Kataoka on keyboards (replacing A).

In 2003, they were invited to play the Melodic Metal Festival in Japan which featured Swedish power metal band Dragonland, as well as Australia's Dungeon. As a result, Dragonland invited Galneryus to play with them the next time they toured Japan.

Galneryus was also invited to perform on two metal compilation cover albums with other bands such as Masaki Project, Saber Tiger, and Mephistopheles. Galneryus performed the song "Black Diamond" (originally from Finnish power metal band Stratovarius) on the compilation album Stand Proud! III and performed the song "Soldier of Fortune" (from Japanese heavy metal band Loudness) on the compilation album Japanese Heavy Metal Tribute Tamashii II. For these songs, the band used supporting musicians Toshihiro Yui on drums, Yusuke on bass, and Yuhki on keyboards. Both compilation albums were released simultaneously in December 2002 on the same day through Iron Shock and distributed through the record label VAP.

VAP itself signed Galneryus and the band set to work on writing and recording their full-length album The Flag of Punishment which featured all 5 EP songs re-written and re-recorded and also cover art by famed Final Fantasy artist Yoshitaka Amano. At this time Galneryus ceased using temporary members and recruited permanently Tsui on bass, Yuhki ..boards (formerly of Ark Storm and Marge Litch), and Junichi Satoh on drums. The album was finally released in October 2003.

In March 2005 Galneryus released their second album Advance to the Fall. They released their third full-length album (Beyond the End of Despair...) in July 2006.  After the Live for Rebirth tour, Tsui left Galneryus and Yu-To (Deluhi) was recruited to fill in for bass. The band shortly after released One for All - All for One in 2007.  Recently, Galneryus has debuted on iTunes Music Store making their material widely available in the United States.  

On October 10, 2008, it was announced that vocalist Yama-B and bassist Yu-To were leaving the band at the end of the Back To The Flag tour. The decision was made while in the process or recording/releasing of their fifth full album, Reincarnation. According to Yama-B's note left to the fans on Galneryus' official site, he left due to the band's growth and change. In the note Yama-B stated that due to the differences in the style of their music, he was leaving. He and the rest of Galneryus and Mr. Hisatake are all OK with this and wish each other well as they go their separate ways.

Since the band formed, Galneryus adopted a dress style that bordered between Visual Kei and Sci-Fi. However, recently they have adopted a more modern dress with the release of their third full-length album. Galneryus also writes all of their lyrics in English. However, in more recent songs, in particular, Serenade, Everlasting and The Night Craver, there are Japanese lyrics. Syu mentioned in a recent interview that the band would be incorporating some Japanese lyrics into their new album One for All - All for One. 

Their songs "Alsatia" and "Cause Disarray" are featured on the anime Mnemosyne as the opening and end theme, respectively.  Current Line-up  * Syu - Lead/Rhythm Guitars/Backing Vocals * Masatoshi "Sho" Ono - Vocals * Taka - Bass * Yuhki - Keyboards/Backing Vocals * Junichi Satoh - Drums

Source: http://www.vap.co.jp/galneryus/  http://www.myspace.com/galneryusworld

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/31969571)

Originating from [Aubec](https://anilist.co/studio/6090/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/242744/) by the same name._

Hosts "That Anime Show" with J. Michael Tatum

Husband, Stephen Hoff, also works for FUNimation Entertainment

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/真木太郎)

Tarou Maki is a producer. He graduated from the Department of Law at Waseda University in 1977 and joined Pioneer. In 1997 he founded production studio [Genco](https://anilist.co/studio/79/) and serves today still as its president.
Formerly affiliated with [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suna_chika)

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/110166086)

Animator turned director originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/110166086)

Animator turned director originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/110166086)

Animator turned director originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118019011)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takasekun)

Originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masahirosuwa)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

Began his career at Ashi Productions. Leaving years later with [Nobuyoshi Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/115631/) and other Ashi staff to form [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1995.

During his time at Xebec, Ishihara would become one of the studio's most prolific and trusted animators, supervisors, and designers. He is best known for his adaptive designs for the [Rockman.EXE](https://anilist.co/anime/1710/) series. Other notable character design works include [Bakusou Kyoudai Let's & Go MAX](https://anilist.co/anime/2709/), [Dai-Guard](https://anilist.co/anime/1312/), [Daughters of Mnemosyne](https://anilist.co/anime/3342/), among others.

To this day he is well regarded by former Xebec staff. [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/) recalls how it was Ishihara who had personally recruited him and led to him joining Xebec. [Kiyotaka Oshiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/119806/) said that Ishihara had helped him establish connections at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) early in his career when Ishihara invited him to take part in the first [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/430/) film.
